body_html:
Dear Vijay Vasudevan @vrv ,

Please consider to review this request given the following
i) A new function linear_cosine_decay recently added to TensorFlow implements some features (minimum learning rate and restarts) that for an unknown reason are missing in cosine_decay function implemented by the same TensorFlow contributor. Note that these features were proposed in SGDR and also implemented here #11749 in TensorFlow before linear_cosine_decay was implemented. Thus, the contributor of linear_cosine_decay function didn't take into account both the existing code and academic sources.
ii) You reviewed and accepted our implementation of SGDR #11749 in TensorFlow which preceded the one where linear_cosine_decay was introduced.
iii) You are a co-author of the paper where linear cosine decay was introduced.
iv) The current implementation of linear_cosine_decay misleads the users of TensorFlow to think that the use of minimum learning rate and restarts together with cosine decay was introduced by linear_cosine_decay function and the corresponding paper.

Please consider our fix designed to avoid misleading TensorFlow users from industry and academia.

Thank you for your consideration.
Ilya
